title: Encoding Speech in Minds and Machines
xlist: Same As: LING 638, section 01
yc_attrs:
This course can be applied towards the following Yale College distributional requirements:
  • Quantitative Reasoning
  • Social Sciences
description:
This class introduces analytical tools that support quantitative reasoning about speech. Methods for encoding speech in computer applications are considered alongside theories of how speech is represented in human minds.Â The purpose in examining these two areas together is to explore the degree to which theories of the mental representation of speech can inform smart computer applications and the degree to which machine learning techniques can advance the study of the human mind. Topics include computational modelling of speech movements, the resulting speech signal, human speech perception behavior, as well as relevant computational tools for signal processing, feature extraction, and machine learning.

No prior experience with Matlab or R is required but some general familiarity with programming is required.
